gov.nih.nlm.ling.composition

Class ArgumentIdentification

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nih.nlm.ling.composition.ArgumentIdentification
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ArgumentIdentificationWithCoreference

    public class ArgumentIdentification
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains static methods to process a DocumentGraph recursively to identify arguments of predicates and create a SemanticGraph object that contains the full semantics of the Document.

    The identification process is aided by a list of argument identification rules, which can be specified per lexeme in a dictionary. Otherwise, default rules defined in ArgumentRule are used.

    Author:
    Halil Kilicoglu

    • Method Detail

      • argumentIdentification

        public static void argumentIdentification(Node node,
                                          DocumentGraph docGraph,
                                          java.util.List<ArgumentRule> rules,
                                          SemanticGraph semGraph,
                                          java.util.LinkedHashSet<SemanticItem> allChildSemantics,
                                          boolean createGeneric,
                                          boolean createIfExists)
        Recursively identifies arguments for a given Node in a DocumentGraph using ArgumentRules, progressively building a SemanticGraph object. At each step, returns all the semantic objects associated with the descendant nodes.
        Parameters:
        node - the current node in the docGraph to process
        docGraph - the embedding graph of the document
        rules - the argument identification rules
        semGraph - semantic graph of the document
        allChildSemantics - all semantic objects associated with the children
        createGeneric - whether creating generic predicates are allowed at this step
        createIfExists - whether new predications are allowed if there are existing ones associated with the node

      • invert

        public static void invert(java.util.List<Argument> args)
        Inverts the roles of the arguments associated with a predication. An argument with the role SUBJ will get the role COMP, for example, and vice versa.
        Parameters:
        args - the arguments whose roles to invert.

      • handleNegatedArguments

        public static java.util.LinkedHashSet<Predication> handleNegatedArguments(SemanticItem rel,
                                                                          java.util.Map<Edge,java.util.LinkedHashSet<SemanticItem>> argStructure)
        Reflects the negation of the argument to the predication level.
        Parameters:
        rel - the predication
        argStructure - the argument structure of this predication
        Returns:
        updated predications
